title: Immerse Yourself in Cinema & Learn the Basics
description: Watch a wide variety of films critically. Learn the language of cinema: composition, editing theory, sound design, and storytelling structure. Start shooting and editing short videos on your own with any available camera to practice.
institutes: Self-study (books, YouTube channels like Film Riot)

title: Formal Education and Technical Proficiency
description: While not mandatory, a diploma or degree in film or media studies can provide a structured learning environment and access to equipment and peers. Master professional editing software like Adobe Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro.
institutes: Digital Film Academy (at Sri Lanka Foundation)

title: Gain On-Set Experience: Production Assistant / Assistant Editor
description: This is a critical step. Work on professional film, TV, or commercial sets in any entry-level role you can get (e.g., Production Assistant). For editors, work as an assistant editor, logging footage and preparing projects for the main editor. This teaches you the workflow and discipline of the industry.
institutes: Production houses in Sri Lanka (e.g., for commercials, teledramas, films)

title: Director of Short Films / Full-Time Editor
description: Director: Write and direct your own short films to build a portfolio (a 'showreel') that showcases your unique voice and vision. Editor: Work as a freelance or in-house editor for commercials, documentaries, or teledramas. Your reputation is built on your skill and reliability.

title: Feature Film/Commercial Director or Senior Editor
description: Leverage your showreel and reputation to get opportunities to direct larger projects like feature films, teledramas, or high-budget commercials. As a senior editor, you will be sought after for the most prestigious projects and may lead a post-production house.
qualifications: A commercially or critically successful project
salaryRangeLKR: Highly variable (per-project fees can be substantial)
